entry.et: Middle English rys, from Anglo-French ris, from Old Italian riso, from Greek oryza, oryzon, of Iranian origin; akin to Pashto wriže rice; akin to Sanskrit vrīhi rice

def.dt: :the starchy seeds of an annual southeast Asian cereal grass (Oryza sativa) that are cooked and used for food
:this cereal grass that is widely cultivated in warm climates for its seeds and by-products compare wild rice
Condoleezza 1954– United States secy. of state (2005–09)
Elmer Leopold 1892–1967 originally Elmer Reizenstein Am. dram.

entry.et: from its resemblance to paper made from rice straw

def.dt: :a thin papery material made from the pith of a small Asian tree or shrub (Tetrapanax papyriferum) of the ginseng family
:the inner bran layer of rice rubbed off in milling

entry.et: Arborio, village in Piedmont region of Italy

def.dt: :a short-grain rice that has a creamy texture when cooked and is typically used in risotto

entry.et: Hindi bāsmatī kind of rice, literally, something fragrant

def.dt: :a cultivated aromatic long-grain rice originating in southern Asia called also basmati
:hulled but unpolished rice that retains most of the bran layers, endosperm, and germ
:a Cajun dish of white rice cooked with chopped or ground giblets
